name: SUPER LOW TAKEOFF - B-17G Flying Fortress [N5017N] Takeoff from Springbank Airport ᴴᴰ
description:
The Experimental Aircraft Association, or EAA, brought their Boeing B-17G Flying Fortress to Calgary's Springbank Airport for the weekend, where it flew a number of short flights around the area for some lucky passengers for the low price of $700 Canadian. I settled for spotting the aircraft's departure, where it was very heavily loaded on its departure to Regina, where it would do the same there. A heavily loaded WW2 aircraft combined with a 5,000 foot runway and a fairly hot day led to this spectacular low takeoff from runway 17. Some startup footage is included, along with the ATC. Enjoy!
____________________________________________________

FLIGHT INFO
Airline: Experimental Aircraft Association (EAA)
Aircraft: Boeing B-17G Flying Fortress
Aircraft Name: Aluminum Overcast
Livery: WW2 USAF
Engines: 4x Wright Aeronautical Corp. Cyclone 9
Registration: N5017N
Route: YBW-YQR
Callsign: November Five Zero One Seven November
Runway used: 17
Local Time: 1145
FlightAware: None
